[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Online Shopping System (OSS) enables customers to browse, purchase, and track delivery of products, seamlessly.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: OSS supports search, order management, cart, accounts, payments, and notifications.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: OSS allows customers to browse products, add items to their cart, track orders, manage payments, and create lists.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: OSS integrates with payment, delivery, and authentication systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: OSS provides web and mobile apps for users and admins.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware and Software: OSS is accessible on desktops, laptops, mobiles, and uses REST APIs for integration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Communications Interfa: OSS sends notifications via email, SMS, and in-app for updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Memory Constraints: OSS ensures efficient storage for product data, orders, and deliveries.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Operations: OSS supports order creation, payment, and delivery tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Site Adaptation Requir: OSS customizes interfaces and notifications by user roles.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Interfaces with Servic: OSS integrates with third-party systems for payment and order tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: OFOS integrates with payment processing and order tracking systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: OSS requires internet for order placement, payment, and tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: OSS serves customers, managers, and delivery personnel.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: OSS relies on external payment, delivery, and order tracking systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Delivery: Sending products to the address.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall let customers place orders and set delivery preferences.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall integrate with external payment processors and delivery services.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall let customers browse products, place orders, select delivery preferences, save payment details, and track delivery statuses with real-time updates. (REQ-INTF-001, REQ-DB-001, REQ-INTF-002)
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall provide secure payment processing and real-time order updates. (REQ-INTF-002, REQ-DB-001)
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall generate order confirmations and track delivery statuses. (REQ-INTF-002, REQ-DB-001)

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for browsing, ordering, and tracking. (REQ-FUNC-001)
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall let customers save payment and shipping details for faster checkout. (REQ-FUNC-002)

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall provide real-time updates on orders and status within 2 seconds. (REQ-FUNC-001)

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store customer data, order history, payment details, and status securely. (REQ-FUNC-002)

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure encrypted communication for secure transfer. (REQ-PERF-001)

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure secure authentication and storage. (REQ-FUNC-002)

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with data protection regulations. (REQ-DSGN-001)

[SEC] 3. Verification: Validate order placement, payment, and tracking.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API instructions, and setup details.
[SEC] 5. References: E-commerce best practices, food system standards, and GDPR.
